author: Phil Vickery
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. Place the egg whites into a large, clean bowl and whisk until stiff peaks form when the whisk is removed. Gradually add the sugar one tablespoon at a time until all the sugar is incorporated and the mixture is glossy. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, melted chocolate and chilli flakes, then gently fold in the egg white mixture. Heat the oil in a small ovenproof frying pan and add the soufflé mixture to the pan. Transfer to the oven and bake for eight minutes, or until risen. Serve in the pan.
ingredients: 3 free-range eggs, separated,  150g/5½oz caster sugar,  70g/2½oz dark chocolate, melted,  pinch dried chilli flakes,  dash vegetable oil
